intro: Piliostigma malabaricum, commonly known as the Malabar spurred tortoise tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces pods containing seeds that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and herbal practices.
